page.title: 04An Important Scottish Town
page.content: Lanark was once a very important Scottish town. It has one of the oldest bowling clubs in Scotland and that is the site of Lanark Castle. All that marks the site is a plaque at the entrance to the bowling club. The plaque wrongly says it was once a Roman fortification. It was, however, first built in the reign of King David 1 (1124-1153).There are disputes about the existence of a castle, but records state that the first Scottish Parliament was held there 1129's. In those days castles were made of wood and they could easily be burnt down. Lanark castle was no exception and was burned down and rebuilt many times. It was allowed to fall into disrepair in the fourteenth century. The street leading to the site has always been called the Castlegate.
